claim: If voting had been disabled on 2010-07-19, the user with Id 58 would have chosen to leave a comment instead.
extra_info: user no. 58 refers to UserId = 58; on 2010/7/19 refers to CreationDate = '2010-07-19'
reasoning: This is a counterfactual claim describing a hypothetical scenario ('If voting had been disabled... the user would have chosen to leave a comment instead'). The database records what actually happened, not what users would have done under different circumstances. Counterfactual claims cannot be verified from data and must be classified as NOT ENOUGH INFO.

content.text:
This claim is a **counterfactual** statement. It describes a hypothetical scenario: "If voting had been disabled on 2010-07-19, the user with Id 58 **would have** chosen to leave a comment instead."

This is speculating about what a user **would have done** under different circumstances. A database only records what actually happened, not what would have happened in an alternate reality. There is no way to verify from the data whether a user "would have chosen" to do something differently if a feature had been disabled.

Counterfactual claims cannot be verified from data and must be classified as NOT ENOUGH INFO."}
